_header: Almighty God that made all thing
_description: The Twelve Profits of suffering bodily ‘Anger’ (Affliction) — twenty-six 8-line stanzas

CULFf238.First Lines:
Almyghty god þat made all thyngAftur hys own
                    ordynaunceMake vs buxome to hys byddyngAnd of oure gyltys graunt vs
                    repentaunce…
CULFf238.Last Lines:
…And graunt vs þe lyfe þat laste schall ayIn heuene
                    þere yoye ys euyr newe
CULFf238.Attributed Title:
Here…begynneþ xii profytes þat men may gete in sufferyng of
                    bodely Anger (f. 19); Here endiþ the profitis of erþeli anger (f.
                        20v)
CULFf238.Facsimiles:
McSparran,  Frances,  and  Pamela R. Robinson.  
             “Introduction.” 
             Cambridge University Library MS Ff.2.38.
         London: Scolar Press, 1979.
CULFf238.Editions:
Kreuzer,  James R. 
             “The Twelve Profits of Anger.” 
             PMLA
         53 (1938): 78-85: 80-5.

CamMagPep1584.First Lines:
Almyghty god þat made all thyngAftir his own
                    ordynauncemake us buxom to his biddyngAnd of our giltis graunte vs
                    Repentaunce…
CamMagPep1584.Last Lines:
…And grawnt us life þat last schall ayIn hevyn þer
                    Ioy is euer newe
CamMagPep1584.Note: Ends of some lines cut by cropping.
CamMagPep1584.Attributed Title:
Her…begynneth the xii profettes that men may gette in suffryng of
                    bodyly Anger (f. 97); The profetys of Angyr (RT)
